value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/2BxaUXlx3K4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI DirectQuery and SQL Databases: A Conversation with Bob Ward
value.excerpt: Power BI DirectQuery can have performance implications. Bob Ward shares his knowledge to help make SQL Databases perform better!  Automatic tuning: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sql-database/sql-database-automatic-tuning  ColumnStore Indexes: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/sql-database/sql-database-in-memory
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/lVXAkfiP1NE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. Then you can update those Power BI parameters once the report is published to the Power BI service.  PowerShell Samples:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MJVSu47iMmo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. Forget the hastle of setting up the App registration within Azure Active Directory for API access, the Power BI PowerShell cmdlets take care of it for you. Just install and start

value.title: Power BI query reduction when using DirectQuery
value.excerpt: Using DirectQuery in Power BI? Things slowing down and you want to make interactions snappier? Patrick looks how you can change a few settings to take the experience within Power BI to the next level!  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI reports for consumers (end users)
value.excerpt: Adam walks through how to navigate and use Power BI reports for consumers, or end users. This is geared towards someone not really familiar with the Power BI interface or how to use Power BI reports to their fullest.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Power BI URL Filter Updates (August 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the recent updates to using the Power BI URL Filter. The update to using URL Filter parameters in Power BI include updates to operators along with the ability to use more than strings and spaces in table names!   Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-report-url-filter-improvements/

value.title: Query Dependency in Power Query / Power BI Desktop

value.title: STOP refreshing a single table at a time! (Power BI Desktop)
value.excerpt: Stop refreshing one table at a time! Also, don't wait for the entire data model to finish refreshing. Refresh multiple tables within Power BI Desktop.  Gilbert Q's Blog: https://www.fourmoo.com/2020/04/22/how-to-refresh-selected-not-all-tables-in-power-bi-desktop/  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Using Custom Format Strings in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Patrick walks you through how to use custom format strings in Power BI Desktop. From dates and time to numbers, he calls out some things to look out for.  Custom Format String Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-custom-format-strings  Download sample file: https://guyinacu.be/customformatstringsample

value.title: Using Power BI reports from an end user perspective (2021)
value.excerpt: Just an end user of Power BI? Consuming reports and not authoring at all? Adam walks through how to navigate and use Power BI reports. Jump in and get familiar with reports in Power BI!  Reports in Power BI https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/consumer/end-user-reports  View a report in the Power BI service

value.title: What the heck are BUILD PERMISSIONS in Power BI?!?
value.excerpt: Adam look at Power BI build permissions with shared datasets. Taking the mystery out of how you can interact with datasets and know what to do if you can't use it. value.title: Age Calculation in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Power Query has a simple way of calculating the age. However, because DAX is the popular language in many calculations in Power BI, many are not aware of this function in Power Query. In this video, I am going to show you how easy is to calculate Age in Power BI using Power BI. This method is very useful
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/a4kPkOAYOvg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI with Extra Options   Summarize Function in DAX
value.excerpt: In the previous video, I explained how you can use GROUPBY function in DAX to create an aggregated table. In this video, I'll explain how you can use Summarize function for the same purpose. Summarize function gives you more control on how to create your aggregated table with some extra functions. Let's
